summary: Contractors hired under personal services contracts operate like government employees. The federal government reported spending about $1.5 billion on personal services contracts for FYs 2011-2015. The Air Force, Army, Navy, and USAID together were responsible for most of this reported spending. We found that USAID spent over $123 million on these contracts in FY 2015. title: Federal Contracting: Improvements Needed in How Some Agencies Report Personal Services Contracts
